block.p: Mary Jane Redmond Hawes, the daughter of Dr. Suzanne Law Hawes and Dr. John K. Hawes of Southampton, N.Y., was married yesterday to James Edwin Smith, the son of Barbara and Richard Smith of Hanalei, Hawaii. The Rev. Jack Burlison, an Episcopal priest, officiated at the Four Seasons Resort Aviara, a hotel in Carlsbad, Calif.
The bride, 30, and the bridegroom, 32, received M.B.A. degrees from Georgetown University, where they met.

Mary Jane Redmond Hawes, the daughter of Dr. Suzanne Law Hawes and Dr. John K. Hawes of Southampton, N.Y., was married yesterday to James Edwin Smith, the son of Barbara and Richard Smith of Hanalei, Hawaii. The Rev. Jack Burlison, an Episcopal priest, officiated at the Four Seasons Resort Aviara, a hotel in Carlsbad, Calif.
The bride, 30, and the bridegroom, 32, received M.B.A. degrees from Georgetown University, where they met.

The bride, who is known as M. J., is keeping her name. She is a director of strategy consulting in Carlsbad for iXL, an e-commerce consulting company. She graduated from Barnard College. Her father, who is retired, was the vice president for academic affairs and later the interim president at St. Francis College in Brooklyn. Her mother is a psychoanalyst in Manhattan and a professor emerita of community health at William Paterson University in Wayne, N.J.,

The bridegroom, 32, is a consultant at the First Consulting Group in Long Beach, Calif. He graduated from the University of California at San Diego and received a master's degree in Soviet and Eastern European studies from the University of Kansas. His mother is a resource room teacher at the Hanalei Elementary School. His father retired as a Long Beach public health officer.
